bors merge

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9961455827/job/27522991560)

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9962671679/job/27526976423)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9963402630/job/27529360346)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9963402630/job/27529360626)
Since dot notation isn't actually useful here, I'm not sure deprecation is really deserved.

It is useful thanks to the new expected type dot notation. `.sSup _ : Monotone _` should* elaborate to `Monotone.sSup`

*seems like there currently is a bug due to `Monotone` being defined as a forall. Not sure it's known
Let's not deprecate until the bug is reported then.
https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/issues/4761

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma mk_comp_mk {g : Î² â Î³} {f : Î± â Î²} (hg hf) :
```

Not sure I agree. `f` AND `hf` are explicit arguments to `mk`. Further, we expect `f` to be short and `hf` to be long and `hf` is inferrable from the rewrite (assuming we rewrite forward), so it's easier to specify `f` than `hf`.
